title: Physical Geography and the Environment 3rd c2012 Holden txtbk
description:
Introduction to Physical Geography and the Environment, 3rd Edition (c2012), textbook edited by Joseph Holden.

TEXTBOOK INFO: <a href=" http://www.pearsoned.co.uk/bookshop/detail.asp?item=100000000391814" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://www.pearsoned.co.uk/bookshop/detail.asp?item=100000000391814</a>
(ISBN-13: 9780273740698)

BRIEF CONTENTS:
---------------
PART I - The role of physical geography
 1. Approaching physical geography
PART II - Continents and oceans
 2. Earth geology and tectonics
 3. Oceans
PART III - Climate and weather
 4. Atmospheric processes
 5. Global climate and weather
 6. Regional and local climates
PART IV - Geomorphology and Hydrology
 7. Weathering and geochemistry
 8. Hillslopes and landform evolution
 9. Sediments and sedimentation
 10. Soils
 11. Catchment hydrology
 12. Fluvial geomorphology and river management
 13. Solutes
 14. Dryland processes and environments
 15. Coasts
 16. Glaciers and ice sheets
 17. Permafrost and periglaciation
PART V - Biogeography and ecology
 18. The biosphere
 19. Biogeographical concepts
 20. Ecological processes
 21. Freshwater ecology
PART VI - Environmental change
 22. The Pleistocene
 23. The Holocene
 24. Contemporary climate change: an unprecedented environmental challenge
 25. Vegetation and environmental change
 26. Remote sensing of environmental change
 27. Managing environmental change

FILE INFO: paginated, bookmarked, true PDF
